website_summaries.verdict: While it isn’t the quietest wheel around, this option still gets the job done, and its delightfully easy on the pocket.
pros: Solid surface is easy on paws and safe for tails
Can be attached to cage bars or used as a freestanding wheel
Open construction helps chinchillas keep cool
cons: Can be noisy, especially when mounted directly onto cage bars

customer_reviews.title: It works fine, spins fine
customer_reviews.text: Decent wheel after fix. It works fine, spins fine, but is very VERY loud. I followed what some other reviewers did and tied some yarn behind the axel(?), and now it is blissfully silent (not entirely but enough, like a whisper instead the clanking plastic is was before). I've also secured it better to my cage, which helped as well.
customer_reviews.author: zzbop

customer_reviews.title: Sooo loud!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dwarf hamster. It broke while I was trying to attach it to his cage. Customer service sent me a new one but honestly I should have asked for a refund instead. This wheel is horrible. It wobbles so bad that my hamster really gets nothing out of it. It’s extremely loud while he tries to run on it because of the wobbling. Hate it and I’ll never buy another one from this brand. I’ve attached a video so you can judge for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Wendi W.

customer_reviews.title: I like the wheel
customer_reviews.text: I like the wheel, it was a replacement from a mesh/wire wheel that was from my hamster's previous owner. I have a syrian hamster and he fits comfortably on this week with no issues. I will say that this is LOUD. Thankfully my hamster's cage is in my office so it isn't too terrible sleeping in the next room--but we can definitely hear it through the walls (it's a rattle, not really a squeak). Also, the convenience of being able to attach the wheel directly on the cage would be wonderful, but it seems it will only fit if the cage is on the thinner side. Mine is coated and a little thick/sturdy so it would not fit.
customer_reviews.author: Caresse

customer_reviews.title: Works great after a couple of modifications
customer_reviews.text: My rats like the bigger size vs their old 9" metal wheel. The enclosed one piece plastic design makes it easy to clean and urine from the upper level of the cage stays off the running track. It took minor modifications to mount within the cage so that it stays put and doesn't rattle. Out of the box I can see why folks are complaining about noise. But after packing the whole axle full of silicone grease, the only sound you hear is the padder of running rat feet. I have another idea to test to deaden that sound. More to come.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C

customer_reviews.title: A 10/10 Wheel
customer_reviews.text: This wheel is amazing. I specifically purchased this for a Syrian Hamster, and it really is one of the best wheels you can get for them. The noise level is back and forth depending on where and how it’s placed in the cage, but it hasn’t been bad enough that I haven’t been able to sleep. The plastic itself is very durable and high quality. My hamster hasn’t attempted to chew it which is always a good sign. And overall it’s just a very basic and affordable wheel to purchase if you have a larger Hamster. This is a 10/10 purchase purely because I have no complaints with the product and it does its job.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Schoffstall

customer_reviews.title: Great wheel, great price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my syrian long hair hamster. It does not pull his hair. It does not hurt his back or feet. It does not squeak. It DOES however make a low rumble noise, but I can live with that. I actually like that sound for some reason, it helps me sleep. But it is important to be aware of if you don't think you would like that. The pretty blue color suits my hamsters habitat well. It is easy to clean and he does not chew on it. Great price for this type of wheel, the cheapest around! All in all I love it.
customer_reviews.author: CCtheMagnificent

customer_reviews.title: Noisy, yea. But well made.
customer_reviews.text: I have had 2 different wheels for my hedgehog. All of which have either contunously fallen over or fallen apart. This one is the only one that stays upright and stays together. It's a bit on the loud side but it's not an issue if the pet is in another room. We came to enjoy being able to hear the soft noises of the wheel from the other room, knowing our crabby hedgy was getting her excersize. This has a small hole in the back of the wheel to allow for drain while washing it which was actually more convenient than it probably sounds. Speaking of cleaning, this is a breeze to scrub and rinse. Totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Syrian hamster loves it!
customer_reviews.text: (Yes she's in a cardboard box but only when I want to interact with her while giving her some space. I assure you it's not her actual home). It's the perfect size for my Syrian.It gets 4 stars because it does wabble & droop a little but nothing too serious. It doesn't claim to be silent but it is surprisingly quiet. Other than that I like it and my hamster loves it! It's perfect to use with a stand or if used without, it attaches to the 1/2 bar space on her cage quite nicely. Not to mention the price! For a decent wheel $8 is a bargain. I totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Elsa

customer_reviews.title: Who knew comfort could SOUND like that!?
customer_reviews.text: The sound is sort of a gargling-rumble, like a major plumbing disaster is taking place, as I hear it, from upstairs with our bedroom doors open. I did not know that it would ONLY be comfortable and not quiet, but I am new to the hamster game and so much more educated, now. If you love noise in the middle of the night, you are going to fall in love with this little number! The hamster spends hours on it running, throughout the night. He seems comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Loya

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly & Noisy; replaced it almost immediately.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a nocturnal runner & you like to sleep, but something else. It is so wobbly, my dwarf hamster would Stop running and look over the edge at the bedding as if he were dizzy or wondering if the tank was also moving. I tried the hair tie trick, too, but without success. Pros: solid running surface is safe for rodent feet and it is a good width/height. For $5 more, I can again sleep at night with a wide/large wheel for my dwarf Hamster. You have other, better options.
customer_reviews.author: MD Fisher

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for with this one.
customer_reviews.text: NOT a quiet operating wheel. I hear it across the house. The shaft that extends into the wheel from the back has a space about a sheet of paper thick that connects the stand to the wheel and that space creates a plastic on plastic knock. The wheel arrived cracked right where the stand attaches to the back of the wheel. Most likely during assembly. Yes its big(8.5in circumfrence), yes wide running surface(bout 4in). But its cheap plastic so I dont see how that is comfort for my hamster's feet. You get what you pay for. I paid $6 and change and regret spending that much. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Big B

customer_reviews.title: Kaytee wheel doesn’t fit Kaytee cage
customer_reviews.text: This was horrible all around. First, it’s very hard to remove the wheel from the “optional” base, I was convinced for awhile that it doesn’t even come off. 2nd, the option to attach it to the cage is infuriating because it doesn’t actually fit between the bars of the Kaytee cage... 3rd it’s SO loud (even oiled), with the door shut, your could hear it very loudly from clear across my house, my poor bird got so stressed (our hampster likes to run for hours). Just pay the extra few dollars and go with that other one you were probably already looking at.
customer_reviews.author: wolfskitty

customer_reviews.title: Good wheel for a larger hamster
customer_reviews.text: Previous wheel to small for our Syrian hamster. She had to bend her back to use it, so she didn’t. This one plenty large enough. I hear her run on it for thirty to forty minutes at a time. Could be more, but I can’t keep her hours! Not the quietest, but my daughter says it does not wake her or keep her up.
customer_reviews.author: John F

customer_reviews.title: Rats love them but they are NOISY wheels!
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing quiet about these wheels. They bang and clatter all night long and resonate throughout the whole house. My two girl rats love them though and the wheels are easy on their little feet. I've tried strapping the wheels down in different ways and they're noisy no matter what I do. They are easy to wipe off and clean though and they seem like they'll last forever, so that's good. I would've given them 5 stars but after too many sleepless nights...nope. Needless to say, I've got a couple really healthy, trim and shapely rats! :)
customer_reviews.author: DLO

customer_reviews.title: FInally my wheel was made in a way that it was a perfect circle, but it was heavier on one side
customer_reviews.text: It arrived on time and came undamaged there is a few flaws. First it does make some sound ,but that can be fixed or ignored. Secondly you should only buy this if you have a replacement axle or just want to keep it on the stand, because the stand is really hard to take off and the part on the outside DOES NOT fit in the bars of the cage. FInally my wheel was made in a way that it was a perfect circle, but it was heavier on one side, making it awkward for my gerbils to run on.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Zoey did not like it, but she was being a crabby princess
customer_reviews.text: Zoey, my 3 year old Hedgehog needed a new wheel. I went a little cheaper and bought her this one. I thought it would be better for her without a "seam" in the middle, safer etc. Well, Princess Zoey wouldn't go on it. But it had nothing to do with the wheel, it was quiet when I turned it, when I set her on it it did feel a little less sturdy than the 12inch one I had bought her before (the one with the seam) but she wouldn't even try running on it. So I had to buy the other one again. I this is a good product, I just have a temperamental teenage hedgehog that needs a therapist.
customer_reviews.author: Genette32

customer_reviews.title: Best wheel, in my opinion, on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I had to return my wheel sadly my boys just never used it. I tried putting it in several locations of the cage but they just has no use or interest in it. Everything seemed to be well made and durable, seems like a breeze to clean. I liked that you could attach it to the cage or use as a free standing wheel (although I never did receive the stand with mine) . I've recently adopted some new babies (6 weeks old) and plan on ordering this again in hopes if I introduce them early enough they'll learn to like and use it.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Gipson

customer_reviews.title: So noisy! And too small for an adult Syrian.
customer_reviews.text: This wheel is so noisy and it gets noisier with time. I’ve tried all the tricks to make it quieter but after a while they just don’t work anymore. The 8.5 inch is also too small for an adult Syrian hamster so it’s not worth getting for the short period of time that the hamster is a baby. Save yourself the sleepless nights and save your hamster’s back, and just get a 11 or 12 inch silent wheel. The silent spinner and rodent wheels are great and quiet!!
customer_reviews.author: Ade

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't use in a bedroom
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hoping that it would be relatively quiet. The metal stand has to be completely level to even hope that it will be somewhat quiet, otherwise it will tap against the bottom of the cage. And after a few nights of continuous use, the screw that is holding the wheel to the stand began to squeak. Not something that you could sleep through if you get annoyed by those types of noises. I ended up getting a Carolina Storm wheel instead.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: If it had not been defective......
customer_reviews.text: If it had not been defective it would have been decent. Certainly a good price. But I had to send it back. The wheel was obviously out-of-round from the time it came out of the mold. No idea how it made it past QC. Also, as others have said, the wing nut shaped plastic part on the back was cracked because there had been no packing material included to soften the bottom of the box. One drop from > 3-4 ft. would have done it.. and did. There was a mark where the part dug into the box bottom as it broke.
customer_reviews.author: C4net

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: SO LOUD! The first few nights it was quiet, but then it became too rattley and noisy to use, even being the house's length away from our bedroom it was keeping us up. We tried taking it off the stand for a night or two, putting it back on, trying a rubber washer, nothing really helped at all. We just ended up replacing it with a Carolina Storm wheel, which is amazing. If noise doesn't bother you it's probably ok. But it was a bit much for us.
customer_reviews.author: Dolly

customer_reviews.title: Our hamster loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this wheel because the one that came with the cage is too small. It doesn't squeak, but you can hear the hamster running on it (it rattles). For the price, we can live with a little rattling noise. I'm only giving it 4 stars because removing the stand was practically impossible and I actually broke a bone in my hand when the stand finally came free. If you're removing the stand, make sure you do so in the middle in the room and not next to the edge of the kitchen counter.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Needed some improvements made.  Now works.
customer_reviews.text: This wheel sucks. It spins lopsided, it doesn't attach to my hamsters cage. The reason I wanted it was it was advertised as having the option of having it on the metal stand, or attaching it to the cage bars. The clip that is supposed to be used for this is giant, immobile plastic. Don't waste your money! Seriously. Update- We were able to use small hair rubber bands wrapped around the spinning part of the wheel to quiet it. It works great now, spins crooked still but not as bad as before and the hamster still very much enjoys the wheel. Changing my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hill

customer_reviews.title: Bigger wth more Room 4 them 2 Run!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I took my Dwaft Hampster outta of old cage tht was 2 small & didn't hve enough room, her old wheel was not right 4 her, I got the Light Green Wheel, Its noisy, its sturdy, The wheel its big, 8.5 inches, Soon as I put the new wheel in her new Bin cage, my Hampster she could not stop running on the wheel @ all, I guess cause it was bigger & has more room 4 her 2 run...Im so glad tht I order this wheel 4 her.....My Hampster loves 💘 it a whole lot...
customer_reviews.author: Umm Layla Mujjahid

customer_reviews.title: Its ok just get the better one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was cheaper than the silencing wheels. I didnt think there would he a difference but there is. The wheel is loud and does wake me up at night. The wheel is also not very smooth when it spins. I wish I have gotten the more expensive option so it wasnt so hard to run on it. The wheel is ok. It's hard to clean because of the indented steps and gunk gets caked up. I wish I had just gotten the better wheel because now if I buy it I'm basically paying twice the price..
customer_reviews.author: ashleyrg

customer_reviews.title: This wheel is too small for hedgehogs
customer_reviews.text: This wheel is supposedly big enough for hedgehogs but it doesn't fit my average sized hedgehog, it's way too small for him. I accidentally missed the return window and now I'm stuck with this dumb wheel that he can't use at all. If anyone is interested in it, please lmk, it's never been used & still in original packaging. I'll sell it at a discounted price. But anyway it's very disappointing that it's advertised for hedgehogs and really shouldn't be.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia M. Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: Our hedgehog loves it
customer_reviews.text: Works great for our hedgehog. Gets tons of poo on it and is impossible to clean but that's the hedgehog fault not the wheel. and considering the fact that the hedgehog is running on it nonstop all night long we can hear it but I can't imagine a wheel that we couldn't. But anyways the hedgehog loves it and my daughter loves it so I guess that's all that matters since they are the only ones who have to live with it
customer_reviews.author: Kathie Van Milligen

customer_reviews.title: Really big and really loud, but big enough for a Syrian hamster
customer_reviews.text: My hamster was too big for the one that came with the cage kit, but boy, is it loud. She runs on it all night and it sounds like rain or a rice cooker cooking. No real way to lubricate it or silence it. Also, there are ridges for better grip, but her urine sometimes get into those little nooks and it's hard to clean. Otherwise, very spacious! Check the dimensions because mine barely cleared the top of the cage. Cannot be attached to the wire wall!
customer_reviews.author: Pen Samurai

customer_reviews.title: This would be very fun to watch them run on....
customer_reviews.text: except my guinea pigs won't even get in it! LOL! I wish I could figure out a way to make them try it. I put food in it, and they halfway get in it to eat the food..... Too much money for nothing that's for sure! It is pretty loud when you spin it but there are some reviews that said to wrap some yarn or something around the shaft to make it go silent. I was going to do that if it bothered us too much, but....
customer_reviews.author: Gi'me my stuff!!!!

customer_reviews.title: Super loud but good for our Hedgie
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our hedgehog. He loves it! It’s a great size for him and fits great in his litter tray. But this wheel is loud! We use the stand and it rattles and sometimes it squeaks! We’ve tried all the tricks listed from other reviewers and what we’ve found on Google. But nothing has really worked. Since he only runs at night...this is an issue and can make it hard to fall asleep. Hedgehogs poo when they run....so luckily the wheel is fairly easy to clean in the sink. Overall, this is a good safe wheel for our little guy but it could use some design changes so it’s a bit more quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Jen H.

customer_reviews.title: Very squeaky
customer_reviews.text: Option to mount to cage is less than optimal. The stand is not very stable & would not hold a hamster any larger than a "dwarf" size hamster... Wheel is VERY loud. Hamster used it briefly, it made a lot of noise, & has not used it since. Returning this & already ordered a better reviewed wheel that has a mounting system. I would NOT recommend this for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: M. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Some Pros and Cons -- Big enough for a Syrian
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the 8.5 and got super fast shipping. It's huge and the Syrian hammie can finally fit her wheel without bending her spine. The stand does NOT come off, just FYI. We are using the stand to hold the wheel where we removed the one that came with the cage that's just too small for the Syrian though. The wheel would be very flimsy if it was used for anything more than a hamster. There is a noise, though because of the plastic, it's at least not a rattle, and it's not terribly loud 8 foot away.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Ritter

customer_reviews.title: Best wheel I've found I have bought several of these ...
customer_reviews.text: Best wheel I've found I have bought several of these over the years for my Syrian hamsters and it is the best wheel I've found. I love that it has a solid running surface so there is no chance of an accident like with the barred ones. And all of my hamsters have loved running on them. They are not silent (no wheel really is) and they do get louder over time when the axel starts to wear, but they're not that expensive, so I just buy another one when it gets too loud.
customer_reviews.author: Sassyscribbler

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much the best wheel you can get
customer_reviews.text: The Kaytee Comfort Wheels are my go-to. Solid plastic so they won't hurt your rodent's feet, reasonably quiet, easy to clean, easy to fix with a little olive oil if they get squeaky, and they turn very easily. My rats, syrian hamsters and dwarf hamster have all loved them. The only trouble I've had with them is that a lot of rodents like to chew the center piece that keeps the wheel on, so at some point you do wake up to the wheel part sitting face-down on the floor of the cage, but... that's rodents for you. I've bought a bunch of these and I'll stick by them.
customer_reviews.author: Magpie

customer_reviews.title: But heard bad remarks about it for center thing catching to hair
customer_reviews.text: I had mixed feelings on this one as I have a long haired Syrian hamster. I previously ordered the silent spinner in a 12" as they dont cary it in the size of this wheel. But it was too big, so after some research I landed on this one. But heard bad remarks about it for center thing catching to hair. Needless to say that was not the problem in our case. Its high enough to not cause any back arching, or to even catch hair. And best thing so far is its SO quite. Only down fall is it does not attach to bars if you have a cage with bars.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Warped wheel
customer_reviews.text: Arrived warped....24% of part of wheel is flat with a wobble...very obvious warp. Not she I can use cause it makes a loud thomping sound..... Update....company was fast and sent me anotherwheel quickly. However this when was damaged and earlier worse than the first! I'm tired of dealing with them at this point. I do not recommend this wheel or this company. Very unhappy!!
customer_reviews.author: Jodie Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and get a silent spinner. This wheel broke after a WEEK of use. And I have a tiny baby Syrian. Come on. For $16 I expected it to last! In addition, it’s VERY LOUD!!! Squeaky and kept hitting the cage wall because it was leaning. My hammy is very light and her weight SHOULDN'T be enough to have a wheel lean down. Ridiculous waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Olga

customer_reviews.title: For my Hedgies
customer_reviews.text: I bought one as a test to see how my hedgies would like it. Perfect size, loves running in it, so I went ahead and bought a second one for my other hedgie. They are not silent, but I wouldn't call them noisy either. I would sleep just fine in the same room. These are a LOT cheaper than the other options, and I'm happy with my purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this wheel, it does make noise but its not some squeaky annoying sound. I couldn't fit it in my original bin cage, I thought it would seeing as though it said the wheel is only 12 inches, with the stand its about 12.5, 13 inches tall. I also learned that the actual stand doesn't come off, which was a downside for me. Update: This wheel is actually very loud, turns out my hamster wasn't running full speed, and when she did, boy oh boy was it loud. If you want sleep, don't get this wheel. As of now I just use it as a back up wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica

customer_reviews.title: Adding has reduced the aggression of one of my mice
customer_reviews.text: This wheel is obviously not perfect, but it is sturdy and I have two mice both are females but still one of them can be highly aggressive and I only had one wheel in the cage adding this wheel has calmed sassy aka the aggressive one at least to the point where I do not have to separate them. I would say it's moderately comfortable for their little feet, and it's not hard to clean but all the grooves do make it a little hard when there is sticky poo 😂
customer_reviews.author: Southern Gal 85

customer_reviews.title: Loud but great deal
customer_reviews.text: I have a pet hedgehog and got this for him to run all night on with the hope it wouldnt be to loud. I literally can hear him from across the hall when he is really getting in to it.Its easy to clean and hadnt toppled but i have a hard time connecting to his cage.Itd a great deal for the quality. Basically exactly what my hedgue needed.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Williams

customer_reviews.title: LOUD
customer_reviews.text: I’m writing this review from underneath the sheets of my bed. It’s 5:53am now and I’m awake enough to write a review on Amazon about this wonderful alarm clock. Oh wait, it’s not an alarm clock? You mean that the persistent knocking noise that I heard all night, that woke me up three times wasn’t intentional? There’s no way, it’s too good at disrupting sleep, it has to be an alarm clock. With that being said, my hamster really enjoys it.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: NOT silent at all!!
customer_reviews.text: Probably the loudest wheel we've owned. It does not squeak but instead the loose plastic wheel rattles as our hamster runs in it. Very sturdy but I can hear the wheel through the closed door. I'm going to have to purchase another one before school starts as my kid won't be able to sleep with it in the same room. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Silvermotox

customer_reviews.title: It's not perfect, but my rats love it
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time buying this wheel. I also have one of those hard plastic wheels that run about $10-$20 more. My avid runners still fight over this model rather then using the "Nicer" one. I'ts not perfect, It's a little wonky, can't mount it to the cage, not exactly silent, but it's not squeaky and my girls like it. Additionally, they lowered the price ($12 here vs $22 at petsmart) making this second one a pretty good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Hello :)

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This product can make noise however that would depend on the size and speed that your animal runs on it. My daughter uses it for her headgehogs. One runs faster and it clicks the other one who is slightly bigger does not make as much noise while running on it. Overall I would day this product is exactly what you need. It does the job and is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great wheel!
customer_reviews.text: Got this wheel for our large syrian hamster. Her other wheel was too small for her, and this one is perfect. The wheel itself is quiet, though since ours is on a large amount of bedding (she's a burrower), it will bang on the side of the cage when she uses it. That's good for us, though, so we know when she's awake and can get her out. It's a great wheel.
customer_reviews.author: G. P. Slentz

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $17 at all.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. I got a hideous blue (it's ridiculous that you can't pick your color!) It's lopsided (not a perfect circle). I can't for the life of me figure nout why a large company can't who focuses on rodent toys can't come up with a better wheel. I might return, it's that frustrating, and just bite the bullet and buy an overpriced one.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Not silent!
customer_reviews.text: My gerbil loves this thing but it is not silent! I initially thought the sound was coming from the stand hitting the tank bottom, however I rigged it to the top of the cage and it was still noisy. So I again put it with the stand on the bottom of the cage on a bunch of bedding but it is the wheel itself that rattles and it is so loud. Like keeps us up all night loud. I returned it and I'm going to try and order a different type.
customer_reviews.author: Angie N.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hedgie, but not very quiet.
customer_reviews.text: This wheel is LARGE - perfect for a guinea pig or hedgehog. It came with no instructions though - we had to guess how to get the base off and attach it to the cage and we almost broke the plastic clip in the process. Once you figure it out, though, it is easy to remove and clip onto the cage. It isn't that quiet though - I recommend getting a more silent one and you'll be glad you spent the extra money. Unless you're a really heavy sleeper and can sleep through it. My hedgehog spins on it all night and the sound of the plastic on the cage and the spinning and his nails, its loud.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory R. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: I want to return for full refund please
customer_reviews.text: Ms. Tiggy cannot use this no matter how I place it in her tank. All she done was sleep under it when I first put into her tank. It's set up too high for her to climb into. I've even tried to suspend from tank side and she still can't use it. I really see this as something a hedgehog doesn't need because she can't get into it no matter placement and it's too large. It's probably great for others, but not her.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Crowley

customer_reviews.title: Although this wasn't proving useful when it arrived
customer_reviews.text: This wheel would not spin upon arrival. My syrian hamster lost interest quite quickly as it was hard to get going. having oiled it it rocked back and fourth LOUD and jumped all over the cage with my hamster going 60 mph on it. To solve this I ended up duct taping the base to the bottom of the cage (which she rightfully ignores and doesn't chew on in favor of her new wheel) and i cut two square pieces of cardboard and stuck the rod through that feeds through the actual wheel to prevent rocking. Although this wasn't proving useful when it arrived, after a few adjustments and some handy work with duct tape and cardboard it works awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: It's loud, but mouse loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: My mouse outgrew her old wheel so I had to upgrade. This one is definitely roomy enough for her and she absolutely LOVES it, but it's SO loud. Her other wheel was so quiet, I couldn't tell when she was using it but when she hops on this one, it wakes me up in the middle of the night. I'm trying to figure out a way to make it a bit quieter, but all in all, I'm happy because she absolutely loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, but not the best.
customer_reviews.text: This wheel is fairly quite and fits my hedgehog very well. She absolutely adores running in it. Cleaning it is fairly easy. My only complaint is that every few seconds of running, the wheel makes a lurching motion, a faster spin of sorts, that sends my hedgie backwards on the wheel. This has startled my forgetful hedgie a few times. It also makes a shakey, rattley noise when this happens, so if you are a light sleeper the differences in sound might bother you. Idk if this is a balancing issue or just my wheel, but thought I would mention it.
customer_reviews.author: Mz Steele

customer_reviews.title: Slight adjustments, but overall amazing!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good wheel and at a good price too! The only complaint I have was that it was a little wobbly so I had to move it away from the container wall otherwise it kept banging into the wall and being noisy. So I just put a toilet roll behind it so it has something to lean on. I also used the hairband hack to quiet it down and I never notice it. (I’m a very light sleeper) This is an appropriate sized wheel for my Syrian. Good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Dailey

customer_reviews.title: NOT quiet at all
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so loud my daughter had to take it out of the cage the first night. I didn't believe her that it was that loud. Then I got up in the middle of the night the next night when she left it in the cage and I heard a ruckus down the hall. I had no idea what it was until I went to her room and saw the hamster running on the wheel. We will have to find another wheel. This one is way too loud.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good for rats and sugar gliders, not super quiet though.
customer_reviews.text: Safe for pets because it doesn't have and bars for toes or tails to get stuck in. Not the quietest thing, and it can be easily moved around if you just set on the bottom of your animal's cage. The part for attaching it to the wall of a wire cage did not work for one of my cages, but cable ties did the trick. For the other cage, attaching it to the wall caused the whole cage to shake pretty violently when in use, and was super loud. So that one stays on the bottom now. I have rats and sugar gliders, it's a good size for both of these animals, and they love running in it.
customer_reviews.author: Kiwi

customer_reviews.title: Wonky Wobbly Wheel.
customer_reviews.text: This wheel worked okay for a day or two, after which it is so wobbly that my syrian hamster can't run for more than a few seconds without falling out. I guess you get what you paid for... it's just not a high quality product. I'm off to buy another wheel... third time's the charm hopefully. I don't know who these people are making hamster wheels for but they certainly don't work right for the hamsters.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Berry

customer_reviews.title: There needs to be a zero rating available!😡
customer_reviews.text: Worst pet product I’ve bought online. Probably would have seriously hurt my Chinese hamsters if it had not already caused me enough concern that I payed close attention and caught it just before it broke off and came apart on them. It does not work as a wheel attached to cage as the add claims either for everyone’s notice. Spend the extra money and go for a silent runner or the like. This wheel is awful.
customer_reviews.author: Derec and Eva Blackstone

customer_reviews.title: Best wheel so far
customer_reviews.text: Great size. We we're having a hard time finding a wheel that was large enough for our syrian hamster to run on. We had a 8 in and it seemed too small. This one might be a tad bit more than what we needed but it works great. Not as quite as advertised but not terrible loud either.
customer_reviews.author: Dez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome item
customer_reviews.text: This is a great purchase definitely worth the money .... I’ve had this wheel for about a year or so my hamsters love it it is quite noisy but I am a heavy sleeper so it doesn’t affect me if it is hard for you to sleep this might not be the best choice because it is kind of loud. But overall awesome item
customer_reviews.author: Kevin w.

customer_reviews.title: waste of money for me
customer_reviews.text: tried to upgrade my hamsters wheel as shes getting bigger now and this wheel seemed to be a go to however im fairly disappointed as its just as loud as the one im looking to replace and is somehow warped doesnt spin straight. if my hamster wasnt already going ham in the thing id be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana

customer_reviews.title: Not big enough for rats
customer_reviews.text: This wheel isn’t actually big enough for rats. Mine like it anyway, but they look funny trying to run scrunched up a bit. They’ve been chewing on it so eventually they’ll just eat it all. It is quiet enough, it’s easy to clean, and it wasn’t too difficult to detach from the stand and attach to the cage instead.
customer_reviews.author: teamnasty

customer_reviews.title: Great for Syrian Hamsters!
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 Syrian hamsters and they really love these wheels. This is the second order we have placed, the first ones lasted quite a while. These wheels are not as fancy or as quiet as the other wheels available, but they are a little larger for our Syrians and have raised lines in the wheels to give them good traction. I will continue to purchase these. Overall a good product!
customer_reviews.author: G. F.

customer_reviews.title: Hedgehogs best friend
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the most budget friendly option for a safe hedgehog wheel - just be sure to get the “giant” size! My boy absolutely loves this wheel and I have had the same one for 3+ years now with no issues. In order to make this wheel completely silent I followed a simple online tutorial where you will just need a hair elastic and any edible oil (coconut, olive, etc). Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Hamster loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really big! It doesn't fit in our rather large hamster cage with the stand, and barely fits without. But it does fit! After adding a zip-tie to help keep it from dragging on the floor it's been running great. The hamster has a blast on it every evening.
customer_reviews.author: Peter G

customer_reviews.title: I feel inspired... to build my own wheel
customer_reviews.text: This is one high margin product! The plastic material is really flimsy and wobbles all over the place. The axle is thin and sticks out in a really awkward way. If I had paid real money for it, I would have been really disappointed, but it was cheap and the gerbil likes it OK. It took her a little while to get used to the way it rocks and sways like a tree bending in the wind. We'll see how long before the axle snaps. It earns one star for being a nice size and a second star for the cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: XANet

customer_reviews.title: VERY NOISY
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap and a good size for a syrian hamster. HOWEVER, it is VERY NOISY. If you can't sleep with sound, please invest in a quiet wheel. It will save you money in the long run. I bought this thinking, oh how loud can it be (because I can sleep through loud sounds) and it is very loud. But yes, I can still sleep through it so if you are under budget and can deal with sound, this wheel is great for the value. But I decided to buy a quiet wheel and until then, I'm keeping my hamster cage in a separate room from where I sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Heesoo Lee

customer_reviews.title: I like that this can be free standing or hook onto ...
customer_reviews.text: I like that this can be free standing or hook onto the cage. I didn't pay enough attention to the fact that there is a plastic piece sticking out in the middle. I thought it was completely open so the piece in the center of the wheel is annoying. My major issue is this thing is loud! Our chinchilla was running a marathon apparently but it was so loud it woke everyone up! I don't really know why, it could just be that she is big. Its' not a squeaky noise its just a thumping. We do have it connected to the cage so that could be why also.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wheel-y good!
customer_reviews.text: This wheel is perfect for my hedgehog. She runs miles in it every night! However, it does get noisier and squeaky after a while. I just spray the front and back of the axle with WD-40 when this happens then the noise goes down drastically. It’s easy to clean. My hedgehog loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Loucks

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy easy to use inside cage or outside. Versatile.. my. Favorite now..
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect. Was looking at something inferior in the store (in that i couldn't attach it to the inside of the cage easily- one has a special feature where you just turn the knob and it attaches like most things do to the side of wire cages) and it's 39.99 in the store as apposed to what, 11.99 here? Sturdy, super easy to detach and clean. Not loud. My rats love it and use it all the time :) 💓
customer_reviews.author: Torri

customer_reviews.title: Dead after a month
customer_reviews.text: Huge wheel takes up a large amount of the cage with decent space for your rat. It was a little difficult to get of the stand and the backing that goes through the bars does not hod in place very easily. However, after a month of use, my rats wore this wheel out. It squeaks loudly after just a couple weeks of use. Had to replace with Kaytee silent spinner it has a much better mechanism for attaching to their cage. Save your money and go for the silent spinner wheel instead. .
customer_reviews.author: S. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and safe!
customer_reviews.text: The most important thing is that this wheel has a solid running surface (those other wire wheels are very dangerous if your pet's toes get stuck in them). It is very sturdy; I've had one for years! It attaches to the cage wall nicely so it doesn't catch on the walls and spins freely. It makes a little bit of a noise when my chin runs fast in it, but I've yet to encounter a wheel that spins nicely and makes no noise.
customer_reviews.author: Viola K

customer_reviews.title: Wheel attachment broke cage bars
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of this wheel and would not recommend. It says that it’s a moderate noise level, however this wheel is incredibly flimsy which causes it to be even nosier than expected. Also, it was incredibly hard to attach to the side of my cage because of the design. Due to the poor design, it also broke one of the metal bars on my cage because the attachment piece on the wheel was far too large to fit between the bars of the cage. I was only able to use it for a few days before I had to change back to my old wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Makala Kohlbrecher

customer_reviews.title: Not quiet at all!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Degus and Rats. The Degus love it, but I think it’s too small for the rats. IT IS NOT QUIET AT ALL!!! They're on our living room, I have to take them out during the day to watch tv. Very loud! Might be quieter if can mount to cage as says, but it's bending the bars of my brand new cage when I'm forcing it as hard as I can to attach.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: hmmm what to say
customer_reviews.text: Well, my hamster loved it BUT he ran so hard on it that he would walk it across the cage. Went with a 12" and that doesn't happen anymore. Easy to clean and use. Its not super silent though so if you put your hamster in your bedroom be aware that night time it is loud.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Hedgie
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my hedgehog, he LOVES it, runs all night on it. It makes a little noise but it doesn't keep me up, Ijust play so light rain sounds to cover it up. The wheel can just pop off for easy cleaning and it is easy to attach to the included stand or to the side of a cage.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R. Hartley

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: 1.) it’s so much bigger than I expected which is a plus but can also be a con if the top of your pets cage isn’t very high or it can take up a lot of room. 2.) the stand that’s attached to it, makes it very wobbly. With the help of my husband we managed to take off the metal stand and then attached the back to the cage. If you have a chinchilla, like us, the height is perfect. I bought the 12 inch gigantic. Now all we have to do is wait for our chin to get use to it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could pick color, otherwise good for price
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge and my hammy LOVES it. The only thing I wish is that I could have chosen the color. I got a green :( but then again it has a really good price. So far it's pretty quiet but not 100% I don't think that's really possible though. It seems like it will hold up for a while but I do expect to have to replace it in a few months or so.
customer_reviews.author: lostravenreborn

customer_reviews.title: Does not attach therefore is pretty much unusable.
customer_reviews.text: This does not attach to the side of the cage. I’m not sure if ours if defective......it looks like it should attach, but you can not turn the plastic thing on the back to make it stay in place. So it just moves around the cage and scares the shot out of my chinchillas. I would not buy this item.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Netta

customer_reviews.title: If you expect to get sleep, do not buy this wheel!
customer_reviews.text: This wheel is driving me absolutely insane. Our syrian hamster runs on it for hours during the night and it constant wakes me up during my sleep and it’s honestly driving me to my breaking point. I can’t wait until the other wheel we purchased gets here because this wheel is garbage. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Safe and effective.  Right size too.
customer_reviews.text: We use this in our large Chinchilla cage; two share it (one at a time) and it works well for two decent sized chinchillas. Easily clamps to one side so it's steady. I really like that it's one molded piece of plastic; so their feet don't get caught in grating (common problem with other wheels).
customer_reviews.author: K. Mendelowitz

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: If you are planning to attach this to a cage, do not buy this model. It is not made like the wheels that are included in many Kaytee cages. The design to attach it to the cage is made of cheap plastic and broke when I tried to attach it. Very bad design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Loud!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s sooo noisy!! It was great for a few weeks and now it’s just squeaky and rattles all over the cage. I guess you get what you pay for, it suits the hamster just fine, good size and spins easily-it’s just annoying for humans :(
customer_reviews.author: AnnettenMila

customer_reviews.title: RUN if noise is any concern to you
customer_reviews.text: Okay, the wheel itself is a good wheel. It's sturdy, easy for the rodents to use (mice in my case), & pretty good for cleaning. However, if noise is of any concern to you. RUN from this wheel. This wheel is ridiculously loud, probably the loudest I've ever used. There is absolutely nothing quiet about it & most nights I have to get up & remove it from my mouse's cage. I will have to buy another wheel because of it now.
customer_reviews.author: Corinthian McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: LOUD...even after trying to silence it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a sizable wheel and good for the price, but it is so noisy!!! Even after tying string behind the axel like other reviewers suggested. I have to knock the wheel over at night to be able to sleep. It is the best size for my large syrian hamster but i need to invest in a more silent wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Devyn

customer_reviews.title: Good temporary wheel for the price, easy to clean. Very noisy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 8.5” as a temporary wheel for my hamster when I get him (as I don’t know whether I’ll be getting a Syrian or Dwarf, an 8.5” is acceptable for both). This wheel is a bit wobbly and it is VERY loud, thus why it is only going to be temporary. If you’re looking to invest in a good, ACTUALLY silent wheel, I suggest getting a Silent Runner by Exotic Nutrition.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: You better buy earplugs to go with this wheel
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to order this wheel it was a great price to give my chin some exersize while I’m at work. However when she runs on the wheel it no joke sounds like an explosion happening. I can hear it from across the house. Additionally the wheel came in slightly bent. My chin loves it but has a hard time getting up to a good speed because it’s so rickety and shakey. Save your money and just buy a chin spin you’re not getting a deal buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn Filippi

customer_reviews.title: A larger wheel is better for their health
customer_reviews.text: I did not know that hamsters need a larger wheel or they will hurt their backs. They love the larger wheel and use it more than the small one. Good buy for me and the hamsters, I have 2 cages. The noise does not bother me since they are in another room.
customer_reviews.author: connie

customer_reviews.title: Happy hamster, happy home
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this wheel for our Syrian, at first we had it in the cage bottom but after awhile it would make a clunking sound when he was running on it. I turned the wheel upside down and secured it to the side of the bin cage by drilling 4 small holes and using cable ties to secure it tightly. What a difference that made. Not only is it silent, it no longer falls over.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: I love this wheel
customer_reviews.text: I love this wheel. Its a great size for my rat, it isn't too loud. She never had a wheel before but jumped right in and started using it! I will say that it says you can attach it to the cage or keep it on the stand. I wanted to attach to the side of the cage, but no directions on how to take it apart to do that. The stand is in there pretty tight, nothing seems to untwist off, and I'm certainly not going to use brute strength to figure it out. Her cage is big enough to have the whole thing in there, so I don't mind the stand being on there!
customer_reviews.author: Jzapper

customer_reviews.title: So noisy
customer_reviews.text: This wheel is extremely noisy and wobbly. I can hear this wheel bouncing and grinding all throughout the house. Tried to avoid paying the 3x higher cost for the “quiet” wheels with metal hardware, but this isn’t a solution.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Ann

customer_reviews.title: Hedgehog perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for our hedgehog (since other wheels have holes that trap their small feet). This was too the perfect size. Others are too small. This seemed like it would be too big, but it works. We are using a tall plastic bin for her home and this fits in the bin even with the cover (loosely) on top. (We use the cover to give her more solitude during the day since they are nocturnal).
customer_reviews.author: Babbo

customer_reviews.title: just know it is perfect for my rat girls to run without any bends ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent wheel, not 'squeaky' loud however you can hear it rolling around when it's quiet. if you're getting this for rats, just know it is perfect for my rat girls to run without any bends in their back at all. for boys, i know they can get a bit bigger, so I'm not sure just how well they would be able to fit in this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: poorly made, super noisy
customer_reviews.text: when my Syrian hamster ran on this wheel we could hear it across the house and down a floor. it is rattly and runs unevenly. It was only a little noisy at first, but within a few days it had the noise equal to a small vacuum. the plastic it is made with is thin and easily bendable. My hamster did love it though, and it had grips to help my hamster run. This wheel works, but you can easily find better wheels out there. The wheel we use now is a Carolina Storm wheel, and is completely silent and made with a sturdy plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Sinatra

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought but works
customer_reviews.text: Ok I really wanted to give this a better review but I just can't because it didn't work for us like the description says. For the price and size needed it works and I'm happy. The stand would not come off. I was affraid to break it so I stopped trying. Probably a good thing to since the clip to attach to cage broke. I don't see how you could even get it on a small wired cage. If needed I would by again because it's cost effective. Pros: Works Safe for hammy feet Hammy loves it Cons: Couldn't clip to our cage Loud Wobbly Brook clip when trying to attach to cage
customer_reviews.author: Crystak

customer_reviews.title: not a good hamster wheel
customer_reviews.text: It's not the worst wheel, but it's far from the best!! It is very noisy!! It's big enough for him to run comfortably but since we bought him a different wheel he never uses this one, he uses the other one now.
customer_reviews.author: JenT

customer_reviews.title: Agreed with other users about Noise.
customer_reviews.text: This wheel works well and my hamster, Barb loves it. But it's true; it's loud. The first night I got it I was at work (midnights) and my husband reported back to me that it kept him up all night. I told him to quit being dramatic. Boy, did I eat my words that next night. I tried the trick that I had seen mentioned about wrapping string around the back part. It helped a little, but it's still noisy. Otherwise, it's great. Haha
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: My hamster loves this!
customer_reviews.text: This wheel is definitely far from silent, but it doesn’t claim to be silent. My hamster LOVES it and has been on it non stop since he got it. The only complaint I have is that it doesn’t connect to a wire cage that well, but the base works great! I got the large size and it is great for my young Syrian!
customer_reviews.author: Whammmm293

customer_reviews.title: Great wheel
customer_reviews.text: My little hamster loves it. It make a bit of noise but not too much. Easy to install. The only problem is that it is much bigger than I thought it would be. And the next size down was too small for my hamster. We have one of the ‘2 level crittertrail’ cages and it pretty much consumes the entire cage. Luckily there are multiple tubes leading elsewhere for the little guy to hang out when he’s not in the wheel. 🐹
customer_reviews.author: M. Love

customer_reviews.title: Best Wheel I’ve found...and I’ve tried many!!
customer_reviews.text: This wheel works great. I have a hedgehog, Sir-Poops-A-Lot (he lives up to his name!). He runs on his wheel at least 3 hours a night. This wheel is quiet, durable and spins easily. It’s solid plastic so I don’t need to worry about my little guys feet getting hurt. Best wheel EVER!
customer_reviews.author: bonnie kamp

product_meta.title: Kaytee Comfort Wheel Giant 12 Inches
product_meta.description: Size:12", GiantThe Kaytee comfort wheel features a safe, solid running surface, quiet operation and a "tail-safe" Design, allowing pets easy entrance and exit. Every comfort wheel comes with a heavy duty wire stand and a 2-way attachment clip, so the wheel can be used either free-standing or clipped to a wire cage. Available in sizes small, large or giant. Colors vary.
feature_bullets: Can be free standing or attached to wire cage
For pet rats, chinchillas, and hedgehogs
TIP: To keep your Comfort Wheel running quiet, place a few drops of vegetable oil on the wheel hub where the wheel spins.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
